result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:29 AM Defendant Adam Robert Nitka in court, in custody.  Public Defender Law Intern for Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Adam Robert Nitka. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 216 Arcadian Ave. Upper Unit B, Waukesha, WI 53186

10:37 AM Defendant Adam Robert Nitka in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Adam Robert Nitka.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests the intial appearance in 22CM1636 be heard today. 
State requests the initial appearance in 22CM1636 remain as scheduled.
Court will set this matter along with the initial appearance in 22CM1636 for further scheduling.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Authorization to Appear, filed by Attty. Nimmer.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Nimmer
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on July 25, 2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

04:17 PM Defendant Adam Robert Nitka in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court notes a defect within the Criminal Complaint noting the defendant is pending on Waukesha County case 22CM1269 which is not this defendant.  State is to file an amended complaint to address this and if misd. bail jumping should have been charged.  Defense moves to dismiss Count 3 of the criminal complaint and presents arguments.  State has no response.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court dismisses Count 3 without prejudice.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED as to Counts 1 and 2.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 216 Arcadian Ave,#Upr, Waukesha, WI 53186
